fudge noun
(AVOID)
[ C usually singular ] UK a plan or action that avoids making a clear decision or giving a clear answer: She suspects that this compromise deal will be nothing more than a fudge. It's a bit of a fudge but we could put the cost through on next year's budget.

fudge verb [I/T]
(CHEAT)
to cheat about something slightly, esp. by not reporting facts accurately or not telling the exact truth: [ T ] I think the company fudged the figures to make their losses look less than they were.
